DOC.brief_summary: evaluate the combination therapy with Miglustat and enzyme replacement therapy (ERT) on Gaucher disease
DOC.brief_title: Miglustat on Gaucher Disease Type IIIB
DOC.detailed_description: understand if Miglustat (glucosylceramide synthase inhibitor) could improve neuropathy in patients with Gaucher disease
DOC.criteria: Case_Miglustat 1. Confirmed diagnosis of Gaucher Disease: blood test shown lack of beta glucocerebrosidase, and found L444P homozygous on GBA gene. 2. Aged 6 years old or above. 3. Already have regular ERT (30120 IU/kg/ every 2 weeks) at least a year; dosage and frequency of ERT had not been changed in recent 3 months. 1. History of tremor and abnormal extremities perception ( pain, numbness, tingle etc.) 2. Abnormal kidney function. 3. Pregnant or plan to have a baby ( potentially pregnant patient need to be transferred to gynecologist for the test and promise to have proper contraception measures). 4. Allergic to Miglustat. Control_normal Inclusion Criteria 1. Age 618 years 2. No significant physical, mental, or psychiatric problems Exclusion criteria 1. Children with eye disease (not include myopia, hyperopia, Astigmatism)
